intro: Oocarpon jussiaeoides f. microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited jussiaea, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanically interesting but endangered species.
